text:
The Research Infrastructure for Language as Social and Cultural Data
The operations, services and centres of the CLARIN infrastructure are provided and funded by the national consortia in the countries that have joined CLARIN ERIC, as well as by associated centres.
CLARIN offers a wide range of digital language data, including written and spoken corpora, lexica, multi-modal resources and databases, as well as software tools and services to process the data.
The CLARIN Learning Hub offers a wealth of educational resources, including full online training modules to learn new skills and materials to design new university courses, as well as best practices for developing learning content and a variety of different workshops.
